text: Went to this place on Monday night football. Walking in looked like a nice place to cheer and get your grub on !! I was there for the happy Hour so I ask the waitress about sitting on the comfy chairs up front. Her reply was it's not a 1st come , 1st served and we would have to charge your party of 5 a 150$ I was like just to sit or is that how much food and drink we needed to order . Her reply was " just to sit. " we started laughing , not high rollers at all. We gently walked ourselves over to the bar stools . Hahahaha.                                                    Over all experience was cool, not a bad seat In the house . Good choices for beers if that's your thing. The Yard was a good look, we ordered up all the appetizers and felt the jack Daniels wings were a hit too. Will be looking for another sports bar upon returning to Vegas . Oh yea our bill came to 155$ and all I could do is laugh because the comfy sofa couches didn't even fill up.
I cannot not adequately describe how horrible the service is in the place. I'm not picky but DAMN. Expensive to boot. Why bother.

Forget about it.   They're closing next month (Oct 2016) so they're not restocking beers and they don't have very much. You're better off just getting them to bring whatever they still have left in stock.

Much better than typical pub food and a good beer selection, too. The steak salad and crabcakes were yummy. The wings were unique-served whole (never seen a chicken that big--what kind of bird donated them??) and delightfully spicy. The service was ok--nothing to complain about but nothing to write home about, either. We were there for lunch, and it was calm, quiet, and pretty empty. I've eaten there before and I'll definitely go back next time I'm in the mood for a good burger or sandwich and a beer.

Outstanding selection of beers including some local IPA and Double IPA that I strongly recommend if you like high hops and IPAs.  Dawren and the other barkeeps can draw them off for you.  Have eaten meals there many times and the food is always good as well.

Have visited there many times over 12 years of annual trips and it's always a good visit.

Great selection of beers, especially if you know what real beer is and want something other than Amstel Light and Budweiser.  Lots of TVs, you can watch the game from every seat.  The food is what makes me only give them 2 stars, since I was completely starving when we got there and was disappointed when I could not even eat my meal.  I ordered the Napolitano flatbread that had so much dang truffle oil it was all I could taste for the rest of the day.  I am all about truffles, but it is supposed to be used sparingly for more reason than just because it is expensive.  It also has a very, very strong taste that just sticks to your tongue!  So I left there buzzed from all the Arrogant Bastard, but still hungry and stinking like garlic and truffles.

This place loves LOCALS!  (And tourists will enjoy it too!)  Go on Sundays and take advantage of some incredible deals - my wife and I were shocked how much we saved!

The service is incredible!  Will absolutely return!
Had chicken and waffles for breakfast. It was not good at all . When walk into place bunch empty tables,still had to wait 15 min for a table

Place gets a second star for the first bartender because he was nice and helpful and told us about the place. Second bartender, Gilbert, took over 5 minutes to greet the new guests next to us while he watched the football game and hi-fived his friends.  

I waited to buy another beer for a while; when I finally did he didn't take any of the dirty plates or glasses away that were in front of us. I wanted to like these guys but come on, pouring a draft beer and making eye contact with a guest is not that hard for you to do.  

Props to the nice guy who served us first, and please know that our check would have been substantially higher if second homie had bothered to take an order. 

I will still give this place another try, decent food and atmosphere. I'm sure next time will be much better!!
Service was really bad, this was in our hotel so we went 2 times. Both times our server was slow, 25 mins for a beer. Also they were both rude and could care less about doing their job....

I love this restaraunt/bar. My boyfriend and I took a trip to Vegas and we watched a UFC fight here and got to experience a wonderful atmosphere, amaing waiter (cody), and the tastiest mos amazing burger I have ever had in my life. No kidding. I actually went back to our hotel room wishing I ordered another one for later. Highly recommended.On our next trip this will be my first stop.

At first we were enjoying this place because we were seated immediately with a fairly large group.  The staff was friendly and accommodating. The pretzel with dipping sauces was good.  The ceasar salad was kind of blah.  My kids said their chicken fingers and fries were ok.  We kept adding more people to our table as more of our friends arrived.  They were good with this too (restaurant was empty though).  The band came on and was really good, but too loud.  We couldn't hear each other talk anymore.  The waiter was also cool about splitting the bill being that we had about 5 different families ordering.  The big problem came the day we checked out of the Monte Carlo and my friend noticed that the tip was already added to all of our bills at The Pub!!!!  We had asked the waiter this very question.  He denied that tip was added.  Our receipts did not have the stamp indicating this either (as the manager stated when my friend called upon realizing this error).  We all gave a 20% tip on our own (plus the added 18% tip)!!!!  This was shady on the waiters part.  The manager has done nothing to help us out.  The Pub just lost 5 families (plus everyone we tell) future business!!!!  We won't be staying at the Monte Carlo again either because of this.
Poor service bad bartenders said they couldn't get Seahawks game but it was everywhere else in the casino then are beer was flat don't go here, until they step it up.

In a case of 'I was in the building so I figured I'd try it out', I had to be at the Monte Carlo this week for a meeting right around lunch time and thought I'd take that opportunity to try a new burger spot. While not a single person has recommended me to The Pub, I figured I'd try it out nonetheless as their menu listed several different options online and a friend said she had a great burger there. So have I stumbled across a hidden gem?

Located in the always desolate 'mall' area of the Monte Carlo, The Pub as its name suggests is very much focused on their beer selection. The space is huge, with a lot of high top tables, and a sinuous bar that seems to go on forever through the room. The menu offers many selections from typical bar food, to some more atypical items like wiener schnitzel, shrimp po'boy, and muffaletta. But placed in the center of the menu is a highlighted Build Your Own Burger section, with several pre-made choices placed next to it.

I went with the Pub Burger, which consists of cheddar cheese, lettuce, tomato, red onion and The Pub secret sauce. Upon first bite the meat had great char flavor, but that kind of got lost as I got into the rest of it. The 'regular' bun I went with was way too big, thick and dry. It had a good buttery smell, but that hint of flavor didn't come through enough. The meat had good flavor overall as well, it was cooked just right, but was not as juicy as I would have liked as there was no mess at the end. I see that mess on my plate when I'm finished and it makes me all the more satisfied. The cheese was non-existent in the whole assembly, but it had ok flavor when I pulled some out and tried some on its own. The secret sauce was almost non-existent too; luckily there was some sauce on the onions I pulled out so I was able to sample it. It was eerily similar to In-N-Out sauce, seemed to be a relish-based flavor. Overall this was a decent burger, nothing outstanding. Maybe if the bun was a bit smaller and less overpowering I could have enjoyed the overall flavor of everything a tiny bit more.

My beer-battered fries were ok, they had decent flavor and were cooked well. Nothing out of this world. Can anyone suggest a place they've had lately with stand out fries?? Probably not. By the end of my meal I was full, maybe even satisfied, but not blown away. This was just another run-of-the-mill decent burger, I feel like a lot of the bars I go to lately are just coming through on creating a slightly better than normal burger that fits the formula. I miss being blown away I guess. My burger, fries and iced tea came to just over $18 which is acceptable for a location on the strip I suppose, but there are far better options on the strip if you're specifically going somewhere for a stand out burger.

The service is so horrible I wish I can give in negative stars. RUDE bartender.... non-existant service (we waited 40 min for a waiter to even acknowledge us) and the band that was playing wanted me to kill myself. The dance floor was filled with old people and it made you want to stay away from it. I did not try any of their food because there was no one that could even take our order. This was just a horrible experience and will never come here again.

Worst service ever. I am currently at the pub and have had the worst service here during my while time living in las vegas. I had friends from out of town come in and wanted to watch the game. We brought them here for the large tvs thinking it would be a great place to enjoy sunday night football. Unfortunately on average is has taken us 20 minutes to receive our drinks each time. We never got our table clear of our appetizer plates. And we had to ask for several things more than once. When I finally got a managers attention to let him know of the service he was very uninterested and looked confused. In the end 3 red Bull vodkas with sky cost $51. 2 angry balls (fireball and apple cider) were $36. Outrageous prices for terrible service. Never again!

We were staying at the Monte Carlo and I'll admit the only reason we decided to check it out before going out was because of the ladies drink free from 6-7pm(also 10-11pm) the free drinks are all well drinks and also one type of beer.  They also have a happy hour from 4-7 and I think it had two for one well drinks and I'm not sure what else.  So my review is a bit biased with the free drinks.  But after ordering the first one, the bartender kept them coming without me even asking for the rest of the time.  Also at 7pm this one bartender did this pretty awesome trick of pouring these shots, definitly worth staying and watching.  The bartender was very friendly and happy go lucky.  I really liked the ambience, we ordered the fajita nachos to munch on.  They had a good selection of appetizers for snacking on and the menu looked pretty interesting.  Overall a nice laid back bar to just sit at and enjoy a few drinks.

Horrible place to watch football. They are inconsiderate and rude. They will let you watch a game until the next patron comes in and wants to watch their team. We came early and made sure they would allow us to watch the whole game. In the middle if the first quarter they changed the channel. What a joke. Needless to say the app we go was over priced for the quality. Find another Pub to go to.

Wanted to try this location for several years. Love the pub concept but, it is sadly done here. Went here as a result of a client staying at the Monte Carlo. Client is from Holland and when we sit down he asks if they have any Dutch beers. Waitress looks at him, puzzled and says no. He asks, what about Heineken or Amstel? She says, "oh yeah, we have those". Now, I'm not asking the staff to be geography experts, but a simple knowledge of mainstream beers is not too much to ask for a place that holds itself out to be a beer lovers heaven. I order a run of the market Hef and it comes out totally flat. Not looking for a coke, just not a stale/flat beer.

Food was pitiful at best: Ordered what I thought would be a safe bet at a beer pub, sliders. Buns were stale and rock cold. Fries as well. Waitress no where in sight to even register a comment. This was a Thursday afternoon, not exactly prime time so the place was not packed at all, just business lunch goers like us. This was not a complex order.

Sorry to say, will not be back or recommend at all.

This place had changed so much over the years but one thing remains they have a huge beer selection for beer lovers. Food menu shrinks every time we go still good just limited menu so if you're not picky you'll be ok. I had a Cobb salad it was ok not remarkable my hubby had fish and chips huge portions he liked service ok not overly attentive.

The pub is a nice relaxing pub atmosphere with good bar food and a great selection of beers. We've been here several times and have never left disappointed. Each time I've ordered different foods; hot wings, pizza, cheeseburger etc; and the food always comes out quickly and tasty. 
We'll definitely be back. Give it a shot.

Ok food, our party had the flatbread, nachos, wings and a burger.

The bill was large for bar food which is exactly what this was.

recovered here on saturday and it was college football heaven.  aside from the twenty tv's set-up around the bar and dining area they have a gigantor HD projection size wall-to-wall behemoth playing the premeire game of the week (unfortch for us it was the florida gators..blech).  anyhow..what was not "blech" was my sloppy joe AND tater tots.  gotta love them tots.  the rest in my party enjoyed their grub as well.  we stuck with bloodies, which were only so so, but we did see some people with the 3 liter and 5 liter beer bong-like dispensers at their tables.  impressive.
Absolutely lovely! Had the Shepherds Pie and it was delicious. My sister had the Filet Minion and it was cooked to perfection. Nice friendly staff, great atmosphere and the dueling pianos are fun!

Beware! This place was taken over by MGM recently and is no longer a real brew pub. Draft and bottled beer, and run-of-the-mill menu. It's really no different than a Chili's. Such a disappointment from what it used to be.

Excellent service to the guests and visitors at this great restaurant the Monte Carlo hotel and casino resort in Las Vegas.  Food is really healthy and delicious with all kinds of other goodies and desserts, and it is a very classic restaurant.  It feels like a warm, quite family style home restaurant.

The upside: 78 taps of draft beer; good food at decent prices.

The downside: $8 per pint. Seriously.

I walked into The Pub on a Sunday night, and it was dead, but my attention was grabbed by the taps behind the bar. I noticed they had 20 or so -- a rarity on the Strip and in LV in general -- then I saw more. And more. And more. 78 in total, with an excellent selection of domestic craft beers and imports, in addition to the usual Bud/Coors/Miller. The menu listed 59 beers, and the waitress filled us in on the remaining 19. I grabbed a Stone Pale Ale -- so far, so good.

Turned to the food, and it looked good: standard bar fare like burgers and appetizers, some flatbreads and some heavier entrees. The waitress recommended the burgers, which didn't disappoint, and at $12 for a good-sized burger and fries, are good value for the Strip and in line with off-Strip prices.

As I said, it was pretty dead, maybe 5 other tables. It seems like The Pub would be a great place to watch a game, they have plenty of TVs including a large projection screen that drops down over the stage. It's got a sports bar feel to it, and the decor is nothing fancy.

All was good until we got the bill and realized the pints were $8 each, which even for the Strip, feels a bit over the top. As a previous reviewed mentioned, perhaps they've built what they don't charge you in a cover into the price of the drinks, or maybe it's how MGM plans on paying for CityCenter next door. In any case, ouch.

So keep the high beer prices in mind and consider yourself warned. If you're ok with that, there are a lot worse places you could go on the Strip for decently priced, solid if unspectacular, food.

Our waiter was great. Jeremy stopped by for a chat and took care of us. 

I had the caliente chicken. It was great, but not very spicy. 

My fianc√© is a lover of salmon and had their salmon burger, while both were incredibly fresh and tasty, they weren't anything to rave about. The fries were nice and crispy, which was lovely. 

Overall very nice but there are probably much nicer things on the menu.

Average food, average prices, but one of the best waiters I've ever had. If you've been playing at the casino, check with MLife.. they comped me $120 at The Pub, $200 at 200 Degrees Pizza, and $50 at Starbucks over the course of 3 days and I'm not a big better and I didn't lose any money or anything. I actually left with an extra $250 on top of that. It doesn't hurt to ask and you can request $$$ at any of the MGM places :)

Great selection of beer and a nice atmosphere! We came here for the dueling pianos on Saturday night. Food was OK. We love the dueling pianos, but disliked the karaoke mixed in...Overall, a fun evening!

If I could leave zero stars I would. This place is a rip off. I went there yesterday for a bite to eat with 4 friends. At the end of our meal we asked for to go cups so we could take our beers with us when we left. So we ordered another round of beers to go. 

Our waitress brought over clear plastic to go cups for us. My brother poured his brand new 22oz beer into the to go cup. To everyone's surprise the 22oz beer fit perfectly into the 16oz to go cup.  So The Pub has been selling 16 oz beers and charging their customers for 22oz's. 

We then tried our own experiment just to make sure. We poured our waters into the empty 22oz glass that the beer came in. Then poured the water from the 22oz glass into another empty 16oz to go cup.  I'm sure you already know the outcome, all the water fit into the 16oz glass. 

When we showed our waitress this, and asked why The Pub is scamming their customers and charging them for 22oz beers when it is really 16oz she acted disinterested. Then we showed the bartender and he "doesn't order the cups. I just pour the drinks." The asst. manager, Ryan Blair, was a complete jerk to say it nicely. He was very hostile and defensive. 

This was the absolute worst customer service experience I have ever had. Ryan Blair really needs help on his customer service skills. They took $6.85 off of our $170.00 bill to give us our money back for the difference in cost between a 22oz and a 16oz beer. 

I hope many people read this review and now know that The Pub is ripping off their customers when they order 22oz drinks. Everyone should try our experiment and see for themselves. 

I can't wait to get a response from management regarding this review. What could they possibly say??  Blah Blah Blah.

This place is the worst! We sat waiting to get greeted by our server for almost 20 min. Our server took 2 tables orders that had arrived after us befit he took our order. Food was not very good at all. Overall bad experience :(
Horrible Service!!!! Not sure what happened to the old staff but the new staff is horrific! Does not know anything about BEERS and service is terrible! Definitely not coming back here.

Loved this place. They have a fantastic menu (at least I think so) and the food is good! Our waitress was INCREDIBLY sweet!! They also had some sort of bloody mary special.... I think it was like $14 all you can drink and you could make your own. Looked good, but I'm not a bloody mary fan. 

When we go back to Vegas... we will be going back!!

I wish people would leave helpful reviews.  I was looking for a sports bar to watch nfl playoff games and it was pretty tough to find reviews on point.  Anyway notwithstanding the shaky reviews we gave the Pub a chance.  To be clear it's an excellent place to watch a game.  It big, very spacious, high ceilings, plenty of tvs, big tvs.  The food was solid, we didn't eat that much as we had a dinner res after but we had pizza, pretzels, wings, all good.  The drinks were also good.  Service was fine.  But again main thing is it's a really good spot to watch a game.  And very convenient to the Aria btw.

They were fine. 
Pub food. 
Okay selection. 
Easy pool access. 
Large screen TVs if you are looking for a place to watch the game. 

There happy hour specials are not great. You can only get the discount food if you order the booze (which are not discounted) so you end up spending the same as if they actually had discounted drinks. 

Services was mediocre since they are more of a bar than a place with table service.

Exceptional bar food, really enjoyed the fish tacos and flatbread pizzas.  Awesome beer selection, wasn't expecting the top tier vegas beer prices though.  

Four stars with more reasonable beer prices. 

($9 Guinness Pint, $15 Arrogant Bastard Pint; they need to learn how other beer bars deal with pricing expensive beers per pint)

I wanted to go because they advertise over 77 beers on tap...but not this past Friday.  The first three beers I asked for were not available.  Number four was a dog head fish IPA which they finally did have.  The terrible service on a Friday night rates less than 1 star.  This is a great example of commercial industry ruining a great concept, the pub.  Please stick to your Ultra clubs and E TV clients, thanks!

Walked in midday on Sunday for a small lunch around noon after wandering the Montecarlo. Wanted something a bit tastier than the food court stuffs. The wall of beer taps was pretty impressive. I was looking for food more-so than drink however. We had our choice of tables and it was incredibly hot so at first putting us by the pool seemed like an interesting idea, the heat from outside was just to much and they were pretty open to us sitting wherever. Turned out not to matter however as the pool people would wander in and bikini clad girls wandering by immediately made this place at least a 2 star. 
The food was moderately priced so me and a friend split a plate of "whale wings" (larger than normal buffalo wings) and a tower of onion rings. The wings were tasty - had a slight amount of heat and the provided blue cheese dressing made em finger lickin good. The onion rings had a tasty shell but the onions inside were slimy.
Only kinda off putting moment was when the table behind us started getting ignored - they were a rather large table and were sat down just a few minutes later than us but by the time we got our food they had not even gotten their drinks. The place filled up really quick too. While we had our choice of tables within a half hour the place was nearly packed. The bill wasn't bad though for some fairly tasty food. There are TV's everywhere so if I were to want to watch a game this place would be a good stop.

Sat upstairs and waited, then waited some more. Waitresses walked past, looked at us then kept walking. Finally, after being sat for 20 minutes our waiter came over, very awkward person in general, not personable. Takes our drink orders, so we sat and waited, then waited again. Another 20 or so minutes go by. Finally, our drinks come by, we ask for 2 more coffees, another 10 minutes. They came back with 1, when we asked for our other cup we got a large sigh and annoying look. Finally, got our drinks, 40 minutes after being sat down. So, we wait, again. At least another 30 minutes goes by, still havent been able to order our food. Finally after an eternity of waiting, we get to order our food. We ask if we can split the bill and got an over exaggerated response of how they have THOUSANDS of people and its just not possible. At least our food order is in, however, we sat and waited another 40 minutes. Food finally came, however, every single plate of food was either lukewarm or cold. We were all starving so we ate anyways. After we are all done eating he comes over and ask how everything was, we tell him it was all cold. He says he'd get a manager, however, we're still sitting here no bill no manager. Its been 20 minutes. I would never tell anyone to come back to this place, by far the worst service ever.

I am extremely disappointed in this place. I came with a party of 3 and we ordered our food 40 minutes ago. As the time passed by I witnessed many others who have sat down after us receive their food and finished their meals. We were respectful and weren't rowdy. I am appalled, I wish I could give this place negative stars. 
After we finally received our food, we were all pretty disappointed. I ordered the fried chicken and waffles, it appeared over cooked and the breading was soggy. That's right! Soggy fried chicken. The waffles were also cold. I can understand if they're really busy but there's no reason for people that arrived after us to receive and finish their food before we even got ours.

This is the worst pub I've ever been to. After they didn't have the first two beers i wanted, I ordered a seasonal beer, and they brought me a Christmas beer, this was in June. I ordered nachos and they were so coated with cheese they were soggy. I do not consider 2 blocks of cheese melted on top of chips with no other toppings nachos. The guacamole it was served with had chunks of avocado in it and no flavor. My friend ordered the muffaleta that tasted the equivalent of a sandwich from 7-11. Overall it was the worst meal we had in Vegas, you'd be better off walking over to the Mcdonald's in the Monte Carlo food court.

Doesn't open by 9am on rivalry football weekend? Ridiculous. 
They had their gate open and the lights on. We wandered around looking for someone for 10 minutes and finally someone came out and told us they wouldn't open until 11am. 
What kind of sports pub doesn't open for the early games on rivalry weekend?

Its hard to find a good Double IPA in Las Vegas where most people drink pool water instead of real beer. This place had an amazing selection of quality beers on tap and in the bottle (over 300). I was here everyday for my stay in Vegas. The bar is vast and seems to go on forever. Always went during happy hour where they didn't have any price specials on good beer but you can get 2 for 1 if you like pool water beer (coors lite etc). The dollar wings and sliders were awesome! Wings were high quality and spicy.  The bartenders were very nice, knowledgeable and friendly.  In my opinion this is the best possible place to go to in Vegas if you are a beer snob like me, highly recommended. If you love DIPA's be sure and try the Squatters Hop Rising.

Save your money.  Unless you like over cooked frozen hamburgers.

And what every you do never sign up for their March Madness deal. 

Stated that we would have our table until 9:00pm. Server (Tim) stated that we were allowed to leave that is why we had bands on. left at 2:30 to cash in bets came back at 3:30 (March madness time long lines) and was told we lost our table. And told that we are liars and that Tim would have never said we could leave.  (of course Tim had left for the day)  Manager was a complete ass and called us liars to our face. paid $60 a person and then they tacked on a 20% tip. What a joke. Asked If we could just take the empty table next to ours and the Manager said no we lost our table because we left. We specifically asked our Server Tim if we could leave and he said no problem this table is yours until 9:00PM.

Shitty servers and shitty food.

On our trip to Vegas we hit The Pub a couple times during our visit. Overall, I would have to say this was one of my favorite places. 

They offer a lot seating, casual atmosphere and a HUGE beer list. They even had my favorite beer on tap and that is for sure a rarity. They also had a decent sized menu and we did try the hot wings. They were good, but nothing to write home about. They had many bartenders on the clock, so we never had to wait for a single drink. I would say the drinks were very reasonably priced, as well as the food. 

One night they had two gentlemen playing the piano and haggling the customers. They played good music and it was very entertaining. 

If you're looking for a casual, relaxing, down home bar, this is the place for you.

We were really excited for 80's night at The Pub.

Our first bartender was rude and made our whole group (6 people) sit at the very back, because he was it was easier for him if we all sat in the same area.  Why that matters, I'm not really sure, because we were all paying individually.

My second bartender was fine.  When I asked for a whiskey and coke, he acted like he had never heard of such a thing.

Another bartender was beyond rude to two individuals in our group.  When one of our guys asked for a beer (a common, big name beer), the bartender yelled at him, saying that The Pub has X number of beers and he should get one of them instead and gave him a hard time for wanting the beer he wanted.  When another individual asked the bartender what kind of whiskey they had, he spoke to her condescendingly and couldn't/wouldn't name any of the whiskey, talking down to her the whole time.

We had enough and left.

Also, the 80s band was not that good.  

Would not recommend.

love this place plenty of beers on tap a nice relaxing place to sit and chill out. ordered sliders and fries wasnt expecting to much from them but was really suprised sliders soft tender cooked perfectly the fries served with dips one was a marshmallow dip (sounds weird but tasted sooooo f-ing good) the bar staff are friendly its the kind of place i wish was at the end of my street, hell i wouldnt be out of there.

We stayed at the Monte Carlo and were looking for some food after a long day of walking the strip.  We decided to stop at the Pub and luckily we made it in time for Ladies Drink Free.  We got a free drink.  We ordered the spinach salad.  It was delicious.  We also ordered the meatball sliders.  BEWARE...they were not cooked.  We told the waiter and he returned the plate to the kitchen and gave us the meal free.  But then the waiter ignored us!  You would think they would want to give us some good service.  Make sure your meal is cooked!

In my self-proclaimed foodie opinion, the overall delicious rating to nearly any restaurant can almost always be measured by two factors - their beverage menu, and their fries. 

For starters: Beverage Menu. 
They definitely offer some good brews from around the globe, but it's also apparent that they are corporate as there is nothing outrageously unique or exciting for those of us who really know beer. Nonetheless, I thoroughly enjoyed my Westmalle Belgian Duble and good beer is to be found. 

Secondly: Fries
I am a sucker for sweet potato fries so they naturally were delivered to my spot at the bar along side my burger. Big strike against any establishment who tops sweet potato fries with more sweetness. The marshmallow dipping sauce would have been a home run in a room full of little kids, but to appease a more development pallet, they need some saltiness to contrast the sweet. It's like adding that pinch of salt to the cookie dough that takes the cookies from yummy to outofthisworld. 

Overall review would be that it is good. Overpriced (but that's to be expected). And caters to the typical American pallet who seem to follow the motto that sugar and/or cheese can make any dish better. The good news is that most people visiting Vegas probably fall in that category so many will be pleased. But for those who prefer burger and fries with a little more sophistication, it may not be it. Although I've yet to find an ideal burger spot on the strip so this may be as good as it gets.

Thank god, a decent craft beer bar in Las Vegas. My service was excellent (shoutout to Dionesia), my beers were excellent, and the happy hour specials were generous ($3 off draft beers is pretty great). I have been looking for a good place to drink real beer in Vegas all weekend long. The Pub got the job done, and was awesome.

No one at this bar knows what the other is doing. We had to be moved 2 times to be able to see the game we wanted. Supposedly the tv's are pre set and can not be changed. We saw the very same girl go change a channel for some one else later. A few of the staff are really nice but the rude ones overshadow them. This was our second time back but we won't be back. The food was mediocre at best. For the money you can get better food an service elsewhere.

I was there with my wife on Friday. We ate at several good places some were free through myVegas, but The Pub was totally out of pocket on us. I had the fish and chips and my wife had the grilled salmon. The service was great and the food was even better. I can not wait to get back to Vegas just to eat here again.

My wife and I watched college football games on a Saturday and NFL games on Sunday at this sports bar. We had an enjoyable time each day. We had two friendly bartenders Viva and Stephen who were great. There was also some all you can eat and all you can drink specials. We would definitely go back.

Only suggestion would be to add some more tv's. The place is huge l, but it's irregular shape and location of steel columns can result in some tables without a view of the tv's. Regardless good place to watch a game.

LOVED.

Had a HUGE burger here last thursday.
The food was pretty good, and they have probably the biggest selection of beers I have ever seen...and entire book full!
Went late to watch the dueling pianos, Awesome!!!
they also had karaoke that night along with the pianos...alcohol and karaoke is always a good time.

Will definitely be a regular here.

The first time I came to the Pub I was impressed with all the beers they offer. After several return trips it's really disappointing the the service is so slow there. I'm here right now and had to wait at least 20 minutes until the server even came to the table. Then he said sorry for the wait and would be right back which ended up being another 5-10 before he even helped us. Now if I didn't have a reward that needed to be used I would have walked out.

Perfect place to get a great beer and watch the game! However, the service and food were extremely disappointing. Our server was extremely impatient and acted like we were a huge inconvenience when we asked for local beer recommendations. The sweet potatoes fries were described as "amazing," however they arrived freezing cold and the waiter would not take them back to be remade. I ordered the salmon dish, which came out cold, and not completely cooked.  They thankfully remade that. 

If you're looking for a beer this is the place to go! Just sit at the bar and skip the food!

Nothing like waiting 10 minutes at the bar to get service. Nothing like watching the other bartender hit on three girls while you sit there, waiting for this unseen bartender to quench your thirst with a tasty man soda. Even worse, the other bartender won't help you because it's "not his section, sorry." So we got a table and told the hostess why we were going to take a table to get a couple of beers and an appetizer. She didn't seem to care.

The manager even walked by, looked at us, and kept walking. He talked to at least 2 tables around us but skipped us for some reason.

What's really sad about this place is they have so much potential to be good and just fall flat. They have sooo many delicious beers and the staff doesn't know anything about beer.

This place apparently brews beer and has their own beer on tap but our server couldn't even sell us on trying it. He didn't know much about it. It sounded like he didn't know much about beer, which to me is bad if you have 30+ beers on tap and call yourself a pub.

My husband tried it and it was pretty decent; we were quite impressed but puzzled that the server couldn't tell us much about it.

The food was pretty good and didn't disappoint, but it did take a while to get it...

We probably won't be going back to this place again.

Went with a group of friends, the beer selection was very good, the appetizers were also good.
We went in at happy hour, $3 off all beers.
We could easily view multiple games at the same time and being able to go out on the deck with the view of the Monte Carlo pool.
Our server, Jose, was great, funny with a great sense of humour  and quick wit, and very well  versed on the menu, especially the beer. 
We will definitely return on our next Vegas trip, and hopefully take in the much celebrated duelling pianos.

Food was great. Burger was good and salads were tasty. Also had the cheese flatbread, which was nicely done as well.

But forget that, finally a proper draft beer selection on the strip! Blanch de Bruxelles on draft and you get a proper pint! (Rare for that type). I'm a beer guy and I loved the selection. It does not compare to a great bar, as there's a lot of typical things that most beer people have had, but it's pretty damn good in the context of the strip.

Prices are on the higher side as expected. The service was slow, but not slow enough to lose a star.

Awesome place to grab a burger, drink beer and watch the game.  Wish we had anything like this at home.  Huge selection of beer on tap.  One of the best burgers I have ever had - beats the Burger Bar.  Have had pizza before which was also very good.  Beer is a little pricey but it's the Strip.
So far the best place I have found for good craft beer. Come on Las Vegas you need to get more options for someone who wants to enjoy a good brew.

I'm always on the lookout for new brewpubs to go to, so when I went to Vegas with a few other people, we were really looking forward to trying this place.

First of all, they shouldn't be calling themselves a "brew pub" because they don't brew their own beer anymore.  Strike one.

But we still decided to give them a chance, so we waited and waited and waited until a server finally showed up, only to have her tell us "I'll be right back."  Strike two.

At this point, we should've walked out, but we were so tired and hungry we just decided to stay.  Our server FINALLY came back and took our order, but it was another long wait to get our food, which turned out to be inedible.  Strike three.

The only highlight that I had out of this experience was that I created a pretty cool-looking sculpture out of my food.

Stay away from this place.

What a let down!  Atmosphere is brash and noisy, food is overpriced and miniscule portions, (even by Vegas standards) beer choices are OK, but the prices are absolutely ridiculous!!!  $9 FOR A PINT?  C'MON!  $15 FOR THREE 4 OZ. TASTES?  REALLY?  WHAAAAT?  I'LL NEVER BE BACK!
Went here for the first time today. It was amazing! Great food, great atmosphere for a sports junkie! Drink prices are cheap and really cheap during happy hour! This place is a must go to!!
Terrible service and all 3 entrees were cold. At one point waitress disappeared for an hour.

Service is great and an even better beer selection. Bonus...if you're a local, ask for a local discount card. Happy hour for you and a friend no matter the time of day. Had the beef burger sliders and they are really good!
Nice low key pub without the foofoo sh/t. Keep an eye for the 2 for 1 coupons handed out at the casino lobby.

Ho-hum offerings, amazing space, but wasted on such an ordinary place. Breakfast was sad. Think dennys/ihop type fare and indifferent service. Nothing special, at all. It's Vegas, I wanted something different and exciting, but this isn't it. Better off at the food court. Price is fine, our server didn't know anything about the menu, eggs were way under cooked, couldn't get hot sauce for eggs, never got more butter for pancakes. All in all, a disappointing start to our day. Maybe good for kids or those not looking for quick, courteous service. Lunch or dinner must be their strong point. Manager did resolve my issue with "lumberjack breakfast" and raw eggs.

Looking for a late night dinner website said open until 11. Got there at 1004 and was turned away because they were closed. Stay at Monte Carlo regularly and always try to stay here for dinner as well. Obviously having accurate information on their website is not a priority of theirs so keeping my business here is not longer a priority of mine.

A few years ago I would have given this place a 4 or 5, but now it's brought itself to a 2.  Stupid bastards.  Apparently the management decided to keep the name "Brewery" just because the warehouse-y space looks like a brewery.  Too bad they don't make their own micro-brews here anymore.  Our waitress, who was great, said that because the tram that connected the hotel to the Mirage was closed down, the brewery aspect of the restaurant was shut down, too.  Makes no sense to me, but it was a total buzz kill when she told us that we couldn't get the flight of house beers...the reason to go here!  The food is still good, but without the beers, it's just another American dining place.  Yeah, they play games on the projection screens and sometimes have live music acts.  But BRING BACK THE MICRO BREWS!  If you want craft beer, get a free Sam Adams from the girls in the casino instead.

Do NOT support this place. They are a bar with bar food, nothing special. However, they feel the need to charge a fee of $10 per person...per HOUR for the privilege of sitting in a chair. As the other person reviewing said, it was game night. Was it posted in front or did the waiter tell us when we sat down? Nope. Was there a line to get in the door? Nope. Was every table in the restaurant filled? Not even close. Avoid this place just on principle.

It is football season and our game happened to be going on the same time as the world series...needless to say the world series won even though most people were there for football except for the 2 tables that like to watch paint dry!!!   They wouldn't change any of the TVs and the servers and hostess were rude!  We came last year and loved it gut chose the brand instead because I could watch and listen to the fame with about 50 others that decided to leave and watch the game elsewhere!!  Last time at the pub.....

Headed here for football Sunday. Place was not really packed so we asked to change one of the TVs to the game we wanted to watch. Manager told us he can't because all TVs were locked and just walked away from us. Horrible service from the manager and his staff. Food was poor as well. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND. The all you can eat and drink deal is bad as well.

We came here for the game thinking their all you can eat platter was a good deal, placed our names on the wait list.  An hour and a half went by and still no table, we waited patiently for our names to be called while watching people stroll on in and take table after table.  We complained to the ladies at the front and were basically accused of lying and we left never getting our names called.  ALMOST RUINED OUR GAME DAY!
Great ambiance . . . . with lots of TVs for viewing.  Largest selection of beer I've seen, and described well to assist with selection.  Steak salad was awesome!
Food was OK and the dueling pianos/karaoke was...interesting. Wish I would have saved my money and just eaten a Subway sandwich from the food court.

Local discounts are offered so I meet with friends here often. They have a great selection of beer and the nachos are fantastic. The bartenders are friendly and the wait staff is also. Maybe a bit pricey for what it us but the atmosphere is great so its a good place to start your night if you have to be on the strip anyways.

This place reminds me of an over priced Denny's.  I would actually rather go to Denny's.  The service is slow and the food is mediocre at best.  Everything tastes as if it were frozen or prepared off site and shipped in.  Not very good.

Everything here is just average.  The service sucked and the place was only half full.  The food is just average as well.  

Good beer selection though.

The Pub has revamped their beer list again and they're giving special treatment to locals. You can get 2 for 1 domestics anytime and 50% off all drink on Sundays. Guess where you'll find me come Sunday? That's right, bellied up to the bar for as long as this deal lasts. Majority of suds vary in price from $6-$12. When paying full price you can run up a hefty tab in no time. The selection can't be beat on the strip, and it rivals Yard House.

Food: had the Kobe burger and artichoke and spinach dip which both were delicious to me, but the fianc√© says it was a bit salty for him. We went there mainly to try the beer since the fianc√© is a beer connoisseur... (or beer snob)... and they ran out of the one beer he wanted to try. bummer. he says their beer are very very overpriced anyway. $20/pint for imports that are $5-8 at his fave dive bar back home. 
Service wise... we sat outdoors with a view of the Monte Carlo pool and the 2 ladies worked fast but definitely lacked customer service. Glad I finally tried it tho!
Eggs Benedict was awful.   Over cooked eggs, cold Canadian bacon and holindaise sauce, soggy french fries.  My husband had steak and eggs which he loved.  One star from me four from hubby.

So I didn't spend a lot of time at the Monte Carlo itself. It was mostly just a pass through on my way to New York New York, but it has a soft spot in my heart for two reasons. 

One was while wandering around the casino lost, I ended up engaged in a 45 minute conversation with a super geeky hostess about everything from craft beer to Star Wars to having brothers who live in neighboring suburbs of Kansas City.

The other, is the fact that The Pub is probably the best spot on the Strip for escaping the monotony of Bud Light, Corona, and faux-microbrews that seem to permeate absolutely every other drinking establishment in Vegas.

The Pub has over 300 beers on tap, the majority of which are various real microbrews or other legit craft beers. Prices range from a 6-7 dollar a pint Dogfish Head type beer to a 500 dollar a pint Duvel, which had better either grant eternal life or be like the Felix Felicis potion from Harry Potter to be worth it. I treated myself to a perfectly poured New Belgium 1554 that was absolutely delicious.

Our bartender was super friendly and efficient too. I won't name him, to keep him out of trouble since I got my 9 dollar beer for the "Dueling Piano special" price of 2 bucks that was intended for the Bud Lights. But he knows who he is, and treating a guy who clearly knows his beer to a little discount was a nice touch in a city so known for being so ungodly overpriced.

And yes, they do have dueling pianos on some nights. The guys were cheesier as hell (marvel at how many times the one can mention his tiny pecker in a song!) but that was clearly the point, and it was an enjoyable accompaniment to my beer.

So yeah, if I'm ever in Vegas again, and have a bit more money to spend, The Pub at the Monte Carlo will definitely be one of my haunts. I have 299 more beers to try (well, 298, I'm not touching that Duvel) and those nachos I neglected to order looked absolutely fantastic.

And maybe if I'm super lucky, the geeky hostess from the steakhouse will be around.

The Pub had an incredible selections of beers. In fact on football Sundays, they had a great special of unlimited food (wings, nachos, pizza, and breakfast foods) and drinks (Bloody Mary's and a couple domestic beers) for only $40 per person. They also had a happy hour from 3pm to 6pm on Monday to Fridays. The $1 sliders were great.
This place sucks! Slow service, no beer knowledge, food taste like its leftover from a recent wedding

The stuff are amazing
Very friendly
I will always be returning to this bar
Dave so many kind of beers
Not a usual bar
Love it 
Very good atmosphere

Avoid sitting at the bar because the bartender was less than friendly, BUT the Bornem Triple Abbey Ale was simply the best beer ever and the Kobe burger was outstanding.  Soccer on the big screen and NHL on the little screen? Come on, man!

Very disappointed w the service here. No one came by to take care of us when we sat down. We had to flag someone down. We also wanted to watch the Oregon Ducks game on the TV next to our table. No one else was watching this TV. Was told by mgr that they could not change it. Shortly later the TV switched to Notre Dame game. The ND game was virtually on every screen. In fact there was 2 TVs next to each other by us. They could have easily switched one for our party of 8 people. Food was avg. Overpriced bar food. I get it that it is in Vegas but the service could have helped the review.

The service was great and the food came out faster than Michael Phelps could finish a lap. Our server gave an excellent recommendation for a local craft beer as I was having some difficulty making a decision from their extensive list. I would definitely go back to try some more of their delicious food and beer. The only reason it didn't get five stars is because our server quit responding to us as quickly as he had at first. The restaurant wasn't any busier, so I'm not sure what happened, but overall a great experience.
Don't expect much when coming here.. The good news is there are tons of tv's and a massive bar

We ate here a few nights ago for an early supper & it was great, lots of great beers on tap & spinach & artichoke appetizer & Flatbread pizza were excellent so we decided to come back later one evening 10:30, to have a beer & pizza snack as well as hear dueling pianos. Food & beer once again were great but the dueling piano entertainment was terrible, not only were they very untalented but they tried to supplement their horrible act with lewd & disgusting jokes, it was very disappointing & distasteful. We ordered a glass of wine with our pizza &  then cancelled it & took our pizza to go, we couldn't stand another minute of the nastiness, however they also had karaoke & those performers were actually pretty good, sad that karaoke performers were better than paid performers

My boyfriend and I went here for a late dinner on our first night in LV because we were staying at the Monte Carlo and were starving because our flight in was delayed almost two hours. There was a decent amount of people in there and the atmosphere was very relaxed and comfortable. There were two entertainers on the dueling pianos that made the night even better. They played the piano and sang songs that people could request and just made the place come alive.

Our server was great and checked on us often, refilling drinks and just asking to see how we were doing and if we needed anything. The bf ordered the Pub Burger, and I ordered the BBQ Chicken Flatbread. The flatbread was okay, it was a pizza and not the typical "flatbread" I was used to. There wasn't a lot of sauce and it was real heavy on the cheese. After a quarter of it, I was full from all the cheese. The burger was delicious though. It was cooked perfectly and the fries that came with it was so good. I was snacking on the fries in order to break from all the cheese. I'd probably order something different next time, burgers seem to be their specialty, but if you decide to get the flatbread, split it with someone else! It will fill you up faster than you think!

All in all, it was a good place to have a fun dinner experience. Entertainment was great, server was very attentive, and the feel of the place was nice. I'd give it a 3 1/2 stars of I could.

I love your wings and beer selection. They have dragons milk on draft, just saying. 300+ beer phenomenal service unless super packed then the service is great "for the volume".

I think we should all catch some dragons and milk them like cows
#DragonTittyOnTap

Place was nice but the waiter didn't know any menu from the stout beer . She took for ever to bring our plates for the pizza we order , she didn't served us water , we had to ask .  The pizza was great 
Maybe next time we will have better experience.

Had a food an beverage credit to use during my stay at Monte Carlo, so my friends and I decided to have dinner here while catching a basketball game. Got their happy hour deal of $1 wings and sliders. The Buffalo wings and sliders were good. The Chili Garlic wings were so-so. In addition to that, I ordered the mac and cheese and my friend got themselves a customized burger. We also tried their Belgian beer flight, which was awesome. I figured the mac and cheese would be cheesy (pun intended), but to my dismay, it was quite bland. Not something I expected considering that the dish contained 4 different cheeses. I'll pass on that next time. My friend's burger on the other hand was delish. Great things tend to happen when you create your own pheNOMenal masterpiece. Our server Jose was attentive, which made for a good first visit. I'll have to keep this place in mind next time, because we left before their dueling piano session started. Dueling pianos are awesome.

Continued Vegas Slider Pilgrimage -

I initally planned to make my one exception to the hamburger slider at Brand in the monte carlo ( veal cheek sliders ) but they were not open for lunch - i knew the brew pub is open - sliders ?!?!

got there at 12 pm - place was empty - never realized how big this place was until you see it empty ! sat at the bar.  ordered the sliders, some fries and , oh yeah !!  a leinenkugel wheat .  the bartender suggested an orange twist - never had it that way - i've had lemon, before.  let me tell ya - that orange twist really hit the spot !!  kinda bummed they didn't have leinie red - an old fav of mine when i lived in the mdwest - no biggie.

the bartender tried to convince me to get their tenderloan sliders instead of the burger sliders - he was right again - the burger sliders were very, very, very boring ! cost $11 with the fries. NEXT !!!

When you think pub. You think rowdy croud. You think someone may get their ass kicked tonight. Or you even think a cheesy karaoke. This pub doesn't come close to any of that stuff. Although I can't speak for the late evening. The afternoon time really isn't anything special. 

I'll give this place major credit. For their superb array selection of beers. Both draft and bottled. The possibilities are endless. And the food is pretty tasty as well. Ordered a burger and fries. Typical bar food.  But I guess I just expected a lot more.

It's a quiet environment for the most part. Several plasma tv's throughout the restaurant. And a few prejector screens. They had only soccer playing at the time. Which was weird because baseball season was in full swing. There wasn't much decoration of any sort. Very bland if you will. It be nice if they spruced up the place. Not sure if I'd return. Perhaps if I can't  find a beer I'm craving. I'll know where to find it.

Firstly we went for drinks and sat at the bar and watched the chef make flatbreads in the open oven. Good beer menu which has just been updated,which the barkeep will let you try before you buy. We used to go to the old brewpub which we liked but the food was always just okay but we tried the food this time and were so surprised. We has the burger sliders and the pub fryer  which was a selection of 3 fries with 3dips one of which was marshmellow yum yum! Please give it a go it's worth a Sunday chill out drink and bite.

Service is a little slow, but the burgers are great, and there is a huge selection of beer. Was here for a late lunch, good food with plenty of seating. The build your own burger menu gives alot of options for a reasonable price.
Not friendly to large dinner parties. Won't split checks. Food was OK, service was OK.

Tonight was terrible. The food took an hour to arrive, one burger and one flattered with meatballs. The sweet potato fries were cold and the flatbread was not cooked. On top of that the Sin City Light was not very cold and seemed watered down. 
Manager took the meals off the ticket, but we will not be back. 
We went because they used to have dueling pianos, but they got rid of that. 
Do not recommend with the many other restaurants available in Las Vegas.

Stopped here for beers and appetizers on Thanksgiving to catch a little football. Plenty of tables, plenty of space. Tons of tvs! I would imagine it gets busy during the evening and on weekends.

TONS of beer choices. We could come here 100 times and still have a new beer to try.  We tried the fry sampler. Two words Marshmallow dip (!!!) for sweet potato fries was awesome. Hubby loved the mesquite seasoning. I wish the fries were a little more crispy, but otherwise no complaints! I'd like to try some other things on the menu!
Great venue with a live band (or singer.) Drink specials (two for one) from 4-7pm and 9pm to midnight. Great place to stop for a drink or two.. or three...

The only reason we ate here was because we had a $75 voucher because we were staying at the Monte Carlo. 

I got the $21 Kobe Burger. Yeah, that's a lot for a burger, but wow! It. Was. Amazing. With some sweet potato fries .. YUM! It was so good i would ever consider going back and getting it again (when it's not free).

There is a shit ton of TV's with sport on too, a perfect pit stop. However i gotta say, at night, it turns into a 'dueling piano bar' at night. Something that is NOT my cup of tea. 

Check it out during happy hour.

i am a sucker for novelties and beer
so i love this place!
the food is good, hearty portions not sure if its from all the beer
but i come by every time i'm in las vegas.

You can never go wrong with a good sports bar especially if you are a degenerate gambler in Las Vegas during football season.

I visited this place twice, first on Thursday night to watch football and catch the dueling pianos. The crowd was older and the waitress kept screwing up our drinks. The bartender felt bad and upgraded us to top shelf - so that was nice.

Went back two days later and had buy one get one draft beers and $1 sliders while watching college football. We ordered nachos and ended up eating way too much food. The nachos are some of the best I have eaten but I still contend, they are not as good as the ones at Margaritaville.

The Pub is a great place to watch the game. You can even sit outside near the pool and eat. They also offer closed circuit TV for big boxing matches, but it gets kind of packed and pricey.

Had dinner here w/ colleagues last week. One of my colleagues has a gluten allergy. She spoke to the waiter who admitted he didn't know which dishes were gluten free. He grabbed the chef who was kind enough to inform her of which dishes she could have & also how to make a dish gluten free. 
Once we got down to ordering food there was a variety of selections from our group. The order was as such Fish & Chips, Meatball Pizza, Veggie Pizza & a salad w/ salmon. Everyone finished their food & had rave reviews about their food. I ordered the fish & chips which is 3 good sized pieces of fish about the size of a healthy hamburger patty. It's one of the best fish & chips I've had in Vegas in awhile. I also got to try the meatball pizza. It comes w/ chunks of meatball on the pizza. I was torn between the two dishes of which I liked better.
The Pub has tons of room for large parties so seating shouldn't be an issue even on a busy day/night. Quite the selection of beer to boot!

I have not been in this place since it was known as the "Brew Pub"....now they no longer brew and it is called "the Pub"....I walk in late on a Thursday after checking into my room and was supposed to meet an old lady friend here before going out......I walk in and sit down and chat up the bartender who tells me it's buy one get one pint free of anything they have on tap.....now they have 70 plus beers from all over the world on tap and I am thinking..........holy crap I am back in Milwaukee with drink specials like this......I started out with Fosters, moved to Sapporo when my date arrived, then switched to a local favorite in Milwaukee Leinenkugel and by this time needed to order some appetizers (calamari and shrimp/crab egg rolls).....by this time the major buzz was on and my date was looking better and better...........time to go.

obtw, the service excellent, the prices excellent, the atmosphere on a Thursday not too bad and the choices are outstanding.......had only my date ended up rating 4 stars it would have been a perfect first night to Vegas...........

This place is amazing!!!!!!! I built my own burger!!! (try Kobe meat) A bit pricey for burgers but by far the best burger I've ever had!!!  The onion rings are way to big so don't waste your money on them! My sister tried the sweet potato fries, I'm personally not a fan buy my family loved them!

So The Pub at Monte Carlo does have a superior beer on tap selection and the restaurant is pretty big, so the wait to be seated shouldn't be an issue. The environment is clean and the staff is friendly. My husband really likes the place for these very reasons, especially the beer selection.

As for the food, it's pretty average. I had Shepard's pie in England  (in pubs) several times and their version tasted like they had a salt accident. I gave the rest to my husband who was ok with it. So if you are sensitive to salt, have a salad.

We also ordered the potato skins and those were good but it tasted like potato skins from any other restaurant. My family ordered the burgers and they enjoyed it, along with the fries. 

If I ever do go back, I may try something different and give them another chance.

The only reason why I chose to dine in this restaurant is because I stayed at the Monte Carlo for a conference.  The service for breakfast Is REALLY slow.  The waiter explained to us that they are a pub and just recently started serving breakfast.  Be that as it may, you can relieve customer anxiety and frustration by simply communicating delays.  We waited 30 minutes to have our order taken, another 45 minutes for our food, and then 20 minutes for our payment to be processed.  This is just unacceptable.

As for the food, I must admit that it was fairly decent.   I ordered the breakfast skillet. Although they got my toppings incorrect, the dish was served hot.  The eggs weren't overcooked, veggies were fresh, and potato were perfectly seasoned.

Loved this place. I wish there was one in Los Angeles.

Came here during Christmas vacation to catch the football games.
They seated us based on which game we wanted to watch. There were so many TVs, with different games showing, but we opted for the main screen which was playing the most requested game.

Oue waiter was super helpful. He mis-understood my burger order, but he fixed it quickly and it tasted delicious.

Oooh! And the oreo shake I had was AWESOME! They gave me a to-go cup for my shake since there was so much left.

Two stars for one reason...

The good? Drinks are good...foods decent (bar food). We know this because we ate there the day before the following paragraph. 

The reason for two stars though? Stanley Cup (Hockey championship) was on (LA KINGS) TV. The Kings are a team which has played one of the most famous pre-season spectacles in Las Vegas year in and out. We walk in and we see the Miami Heat 2nd round playoff game is on, plus some Euro soccer game. Every TV is covering these two games (minimum of 20 TVs). We ask the manager, can you throw on the Stanley Cup game for us please (all we asked for was one TV), and he replied, "No". We explained our position, again, "no". 

Enough said, see ya later. Off to Diablos we went who were more then willing to accommodate us. 

Poor move The Pub.

I really liked this place. Good if you are looking for a laid-back scene and LARGE beers. Came here on a Friday night and there was some live music playing...entertaining to watch. I especially liked the really, super large beer that come with their own tap to share with your group. Ate dinner here also and the servings were large and food was pretty good. Good place to chill if you're staying at the Monte Carlo.

We are here at the pub and came to order the yard of beer we ordered last time and they no longer have those here.   That was what made them better than all the other places around here in the hotel.   And the food just wasn't good and the beer was barely even colder than room temperature.  Won't be coming back here in the near future.   That is for sure

This place is just average, and the food is what you would expect with average pub fare.  I hoped for so much more as they have an extensive beer selection and I love their marketing flyers that you see all around the casino about funny mis-named beers (i.e. Pansy Ass Ale).  I went for the local Nevada flight of beers, and it was a good way to sample a few of the local beers.  The friends enjoyed the flatbread and mini-sliders.  As mentioned, they have a good selection of beers but not cheap.  I suggest going to one of the other brewery locations to get your drink on.

went here with friends a few months ago. the food was quite tasty - a bit pricey, but the booze is where they lose a few stars. i ordered a shot of butterscotch schnapps with baileys. the drink has had a few different obnoxious names since the first time i had one years ago, so i described it instead of naming it. the bill came out and i was charged $10.00 for it. for a shot?! what a rip! waiters were nice and brought us extra placemats. we asked for extra because they were kind of cool - replicas of old news stories on a parchment-type paper. we took some home as souvenirs.
Watched some football and had some pretty good food.  We liked it our experience there.  We had the Wings and potato skins and both were very good.   Service was good :)

Loved this bar! We went a couple times during happy hour and they had $3 draft house IPA. Great price and great flavor! The bartenders and the servers were very nice and helpful when it came to deciding what to get. We had the chips and salsa and the pretzels and both were great. The salsa was flavorful and had a kick and the pretzels were a great price for the amount you got. 

If you don't like IPAs they had a great selection of beers both on tap and in bottles. I'm not sure what their normal menu was like but if it's anything like their happy hour menu you'll be good to go.

Went here with my husband. I had the macaroni and cheese (which is an appetizer) and my husband had the pub burger with bacon and egg. He claims that it was the best burger that he has ever eaten. The staff was friendly and attentive, I would absolutely return.

Probably a great place for lunch. At night, I'd give this place negative stars if I could ... wait till the band, Zowie Bowie, starts and you will want to give it negative one million stars. 

CONS: Zowie Bowie -- They are bad beyond description. And then they turn the damn thing up so loud you can't see straight or hear a person 6" away from you without screaming. I guess when you get the volume  up loud enough you almost can't tell how bad the band is, perhaps it is their plan. If it wasn't obvious from the posters all over the place that this band is a joke, please resist and temptation to check out this venue for the band.

CONS: Table service & bar service are ridiculously slow.

PROS: You get in free if you are staying at the hotel (I can't imagine paying a cover to go in here) so you are not out anything when you leave.

PROS: Hey, if you go with a great set of friends anyplace can be great!

Love this place. Great service, awesome happy hour specials (2 for 1 drinks for the guys/ ladies drink free) and plenty of seating, especially for large parties. 8-10? No problem. Any large sports event, they have plenty of tvs, all you can eat buffets and great raffle prizes. Always a sure stop when in Vegas.

One Monday last January in Vegas, we couldn't figure out what to do.  Wasn't really in the mood to drink (WHAT, in LV and don't want to drink???)  Yes, we partied too hard the previous weekend but.....

I love Microbreweries and I always heard about the Monte Carlo Brew Pub.  So we just dropped on by.  We got there right when the kitchen was closing so we couldn't get any food.  And then when we sat down, the bartender told us that this place actually did NOT brew their own beers so it was kinda disappointing right off the bat...  

But after we ordered some beers, and the bartender was so friendly, everything turned out real good...  

It was actually 80s night so they were playing a lot of old videos on the Big Screens so what started out as a possible bad experience in fact, turned out to be a Great and very Fun Time!

Came here for lunch and it was a very inexpensive good lunch.  My husband had a chicken burger and I enjoyed some $1 sliders during Happy Hour, both were good.  It wasn't too crowded inside, it looked like everyone chose to sit outside.  We didn't try any of the beers, so I can't really comment on that, but we were seated next to one guy who would not stop complaining about the lack of beer choices.  (I thought he was being dramatic, they seem to have  A LOT of beers to choose from, he was just being difficult.)  Service was pretty quick and the bill was less than other meals we had in Vegas.  

I would recommend for a quick cheap bite.

Every time I think about this place now... it just makes me laugh.

Just before causing trouble on our first night, we arrive at the Pub looking for some dinner. We place our names down for a table and was informed there is a 10 minute wait. The hostess says we are free to grab a drink at the bar to wait. So we stop by the bar which overlooks the main dining area and the guys playing the dueling pianos. We immediately notice, there has to be like 20+ some odd tables that are open but we wait. In about 5 minutes, I stop by an ask the hostess if there was a table available and she says "no not yet, you have about 6 minutes left". Yes, she really did said 6 minutes. So I go back tell everyone what she had told me and we all have a good laugh. So we wait exactly 10 minutes (no joke) and we get seated.

We get seated right in front of the stage with the dueling pianos which is kind of cool and kind of loud making it difficult to talk to the others in the group. After getting seated, we wait for the waiter to stop by the table. We wait some more. About 20 minutes rolls by and someone in our group finally grabs anyone that works there to get our drink and food order. We order the calamari for the group to share and my gf and I get a margherita pizza to share between the both of us. The food is just average and for drinks its hard for the bartender to screw up Ketel One on the rocks so there isn't much to comment on.

Skipping to the end, I think The Pub should change its name to The Wait because if you come here, you will definitely be waiting a lot. Its not like the place was packed on this Friday night with the 20+ open tables in the joint (which probably says a lot right there), but service is definitely lacking here. The only highlight of the night was dueling pianos and the guys playing them. They were awesome and quite funny. Unfortunately, I don't think it was enough to make up for everything else this restaurant did wrong. We had a good time despite the many flaws this place had and I think that 2 stars it a more than fair rating for The Wait... err The Pub.

We we very dissapointed in this place, however, this was not the first time we were here. We have come to love this place, the food, the service, the environment. That is until yesterday. The menu changed, the service was not so good, and the environment was definitely drab and at that the food was overprised for the quality, and The food was not good. My daughter had the chicken wings, which by the way, tasted like cardboard, the portabella burger was more bun than anything, and the onion rings tasted like oil. Needless to say, I barely ate. So not worth the $97 bill. Sorry to say that after a handful of visits over the past year, we will never be back.

Good food and friendly staff.

My boyfriend got the house burger and I ordered the meatball pizza. They were both pretty good and we were starving so they were filling.

Was here in 2010 and it was great. So sad to see it go to shit. Too forever to get served. Ordered a local beer to find it come in a bottle; it was not clear on the menu that it was a bottle and not on draft. Piano bar was pretty cool if you can make it there and have no rush or desire to be served with good customer service.

This place has changed names several times over the years, but the basic concept of sports pub has stayed the same. It has consistently offered fine burgers. My favorite is currently the mushroom burger. The flatbread pizzas and chicken wings are quite tasty too. 

The current stand out feature of this place has to be the "all-you-can-drink, make-your-own-drink," bar buffet. Not sure if it is offered year-round, but we were there on a Saturday in October for college football. It works like this: Pay $30 and from 11:00AM to 3:00PM you walk up to the bartender, who pours you whatever poison you want, as many times as you want during those 4 hours. There is a table set up with all sorts of mixing ingredients for you to get creative with. I made one hell of a Bloody Mary...just couldn't say no to all the different peppers and horseradish in front of me. (Tip: You may want to consider staying at the Monte Carlo if you are considering this. It is quite difficult to make it anywhere else after taking advantage of the full 4 hours).

Honestly, why does this place exist. The hostess is lousy and so are the wait staff. The place was pretty empty when my friends and I went. There was an event for piano dueling and one of my friend wanted to go and see. We were going to have a couple of beers and an appetizer then head on to dinner afterwards. The hostess said that we have to wait at least 10 minutes for a table. We only had a party of five and there were bar tables and long tables unoccupied. We waited anyhow and we were showed to our table.  He ID'd everyone because you have to be 18 and over when you're in the pub. We were ordering our drink and I told our waiter, Timothy, that I was sick and I did not want to drink alcohol. I asked if he had any other drinks other than beer and he gave me an attitude by saying "do you mean non-alcoholic drinks?" After that happened, i ended ordering the ice tea, my friend ordered a sweet bear, two miller lites, and a pear cider. We also ordered the Chili Garlic chicken wings because Timothy suggested it and it was edible. Nothing I would go running back for and definitely would not beg to eat. The way he gave us our food is the most aggravating part. Like I said, I ordered the tea and he slammed down the sugar next to me and the tea. He proceeded with tossing me the straw. The worst server I have ever encounter. I was wondering why it was so slow because they had an event going. I figured it was because of the night club goers, but it's just the horrible customer service. He slammed every drink and our appetizer. I asked him for napkins because I was sick and my nose was running, but he took his sweet time getting it for me. We kept trying to get his attention to ask him for to get another order for my friend's food and another cider, but he's not attentive whatsoever. We finally got his attention and he responded with "got it." I don't understand why you would open a business just to watch it fail with your employees but it is their business. It was also difficult getting the check. Our bill came out to be around 50~. We gave him our card and he came back with it. I expected a "thank you and have a great night" and what I actually got was "just sign it and leave it there" we tipped out of courtesy, but we were bitter about it. I doubt that they will survive because one of the yelpers explained that it actually changed to a pub, but they would not get any money from me anymore. 

Bottom line: Even if you want to grab a bite and thought about this place, just go to McDonalds. If you wanted to drink, just go to the casino and order the drink then tip the cocktail waitress. Avoid at all cost.

This review is also for the two bartenders who were mentioned in a previous comment. 
When I arrived at the bar, two black males had been standing there waiting for drinks. They were completely and blatantly ignored. The bartender did the same to me as I watched him serve all the other white patrons. When I asked him if I would get some service, 20 minutes later, he acted as if I didn't exist. So I decided to walk away and someone else offered to buy my drinks. She was served by the other Hispanic bartender who was cordial and respectful to everyone who was ordering. 
Later that night, we moved to the back corner of the pub. I was told that the younger bartender was fair because he did first-come-first-serve. Once again, I stood there for a long time as he served all the other white patrons around me. When I asked for service, he just shrugged his shoulders and served people who only showed up a minute beforehand. 
I brushed off the first incident but when it is done multiple times, it's a pattern and it's obviously racist. I had warned a few other colored people at the bar about the worst service I have ever experienced. They later came up to me and told me they were refused service as well. They were mostly Kenyan and Fijian patrons. 
Do not support an establishment that practices blatant racism, discrimination and disrespect. I will never spend another penny at this pub and at the Monte Carlo ever again!! You shouldn't either.

Locals get happy hour all the time. 

My friend and I ordered the spinach dip for an appetizer and it was really good! Very cheesy! I also had the Philly cheesesteak sliders with fries. The sliders were only okay because there was a cheese sauce that comes on them that is a little spicy and awkward for a Philly. The fries were really good though!

Service wasn't great and we went late afternoon when it wasn't that busy.

2.5 stars?
I can't review the food: as a bar it's fine, not great. It's Vegas, so I feel like there is always going to be some element of big bars feeling like a cattle call with hit or miss service, but because we were staying there and it became our default bar, we got a good feeling for what this place was about. Roughly 30 of us stayed in the Monte Carlo, and overall the experiences I kept having and hearing were the same: hit or miss with service. Some of the bartenders were excellent, some were surly and took forever. The hostess was consistently rude. Sometimes we felt welcomed, sometimes we felt like we should just leave. 
It was fine because it was in the hotel, we were mostly just happy to (eventually) get a drink and see each other, and when the Spazmatics played (the 80s cover band) we all had a blast dancing and singing along. But otherwise we'd probably not have chosen to go there and by the end of the trip we were actively avoiding it.

Had a quick bite to eat at the Pub at Monte Carlo during Happy Hour.

They have $1 sliders M-F from 3p-6p and drink specials as well.

We ordered six sliders which were perfect and very tasty.  The chicken wings were $1 each as well, but we didn't order any, which was okay, since the order of fries we had on the side was a HUGE portion.  They also have a wide selection of beers and drinks, if you are local to Vegas, you also have Happy Hour prices 24/7, I wish I lived in Vegas full time.  :)

The service was good and since we were stopping in mid afternoon, it wasn't too packed yet, had lunch here on a Saturday.  They do have multiple TV's so pretty much anywhere you sit, you will be able to catch a game.
